title: What is the most worth it storage expansion for series x?
body: I wanna know what most of you series x users use for storage expansion and what will be the most recommended nowadays for 1 tb expansion? Wether it's expansion card, external ssd, sata ssd with adapter or even hdd
author: Plastic-Spell-9508

comments.body: The official Seagate Expansion Card is the way to go. It supports all games made for the XBox Series S | X. If you only want storage for legacy titles, XBox 360 titles, etc., you can plug in an external USB drive and run them from there.
comments.author: StorminXX

comments.body: Mostly X|S games and wouldn't mind transferring data but I feel nowadays after the ssds price increase that reliable ssds caught up to the price of expansion cards
comments.author: Plastic-Spell-9508

comments.body: I use the 1TB expansion card from Seagate, I really wish i could fork over the caps to get myself the 4TB one, but sheesh that price is wild
comments.author: Lonely_Dovah

comments.body: I use the Seagate 2TB expansion card. I would still like to buy the 4TB one. But its price is high.
comments.author: Natanael_155

comments.body: At that point you would be better adding a 4 tb hdd maybe
comments.author: Plastic-Spell-9508

comments.body: And if it's ssd what would be the best pick now, given that the usb port it usb 3.0 and would bottleneck expensive highend ssds and make them pointless.
comments.author: Plastic-Spell-9508

comments.body: Just double checking ... you know that USB anything won't be able to play Series X|S optimized games, right? Cheapest would probably be a USB HDD though.
comments.author: modemman11
